page.title: 11FOOTPATHS AND BRIDLEWAYS
page.content: There are plenty of footpaths, bridleways and farm tracks which criss-cross the countryside, although some of the footpaths are overgrown. Some of the wo od land, especially Great Monks Wood are full of wild flowers. The main species to be found are: primroses cowslips violets bluebells campions orchids wood anenomes as well as the more common varieties. The hedgerows are an abundance of hedge parsley in the late spring. While the nightingale visits Nunty's Wood the kingfisher is a resident along the streams and brooks. The streams are full of weed in summer because of the high nitrate level. The dragonflies and damselflies are also dazzling to the eye along these streams in the summer months.
